meanings.definition: To anchor together with another object or person.
meanings.sent1: The boat and the buoy coanchored in the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The two friends coanchored their boats to prevent drifting.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel and the bird coanchored their nests in the same tree.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the trees coanchored the soil, preventing erosion.
meanings.sent5: The magnets coanchored firmly, unable to be separated.

meanings.definition: To be anchored together with another object or person.
meanings.sent1: The ship coanchored with the dock during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The flags coanchored on the mast fluttered in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The siblings coanchored their bikes to the same post.
meanings.sent4: The vines coanchored, creating a beautiful natural archway.
meanings.sent5: The climbers coanchored their ropes for safety while ascending.
